Basic Aeroallergen Course ................ 51 Atopic Dermatitis Course .................. 52 Military Allergy Program .................... 51 Friday Sessions ................................. 55 Saturday Sessions ............................ 68 Sunday Sessions .............................. 83 Monday Sessions .............................. 95 Pre-Recorded Sessions ................... 102 Directories Exhibits ........................................... 110 Floor Plans ...................................... 131 Faculty Index .................................. 137 Keyword Index ................................ 143 Staff ............................................... 145 AAAAI-0123-100 The AAAAI Annual Meeting is not a public event. Programs presented at the Annual Meeting are for the education of attendees and purchasers of livestreamed and recorded presentations as authorized by the AAAAI. Any use of program content, the name of a speaker and/or program title, or the name of the AAAAI without the written consent of the AAAAI is prohibited. The "program content" includes, but is not limited to, oral presentations, audio visual materials used by the speakers and program handouts. This rule applies before, during and/or after the meeting. The AAAAI endorses only those activities described in this printed program. Any other events occurring in the city of San Antonio, Texas during the AAAAI Annual Meeting are not sanctioned by the AAAAI.Dear Colleagues, Welcome to the 2023 AAAAI Annual Meeting. This is the A/I event of the year where you will experience interactive training stations, dedicated networking lounges, highly anticipated research highlights and of course, transformative educational sessions. Over 400 faculty members will be speaking, and they are ready to answer questions and engage in discussion with you. You are a part of the community of thousands of A/I clinicians from around the world who have gathered together to learn from top experts in the field, exchange ideas and best practices, make new connections and access cutting-edge research. We thank you in advance for following our health and safety protocols that will ensure a safe, informative and successful Annual Meeting. The Annual Meeting Program Committee has again constructed an impressive program, including a wide variety of content-rich sessions covering the latest in A/I, with many built around our "Optimizing Scope of Practice" theme. While the theme covers about 20% of our sessions, the remaining 80% were developed through member submissions and include a robust selection of basic and clinical science programming. The labels and key inside this program will help you determine which sessions relate to the theme and to our other session tracks, and which sessions are being livestreamed for those who opted to attend the 2023 Annual Meeting virtually. Other virtual components include a set of pre-recorded sessions to be viewed at your convenience, the recording of a select number of live sessions that will be uploaded online and a virtual Poster Hall. Add These High-Impact Sessions to Your Meeting Schedule Friday at 1:45 pm is the Presidential Plenary: Paradigm Shifts in Drug Allergy, which will serve as a major update to the field of drug allergy. You will hear about new insights into the immunopathology of Aspirin- exacerbated Respiratory Disease, advances in the diagnosis and management of Severe Cutaneous Adverse Reaction and practice changers from Drug Allergy: A 2022 Practice Parameter Update. Our plenary sessions continue at 8:15 am on Saturday and Sunday, and at 9:30 am on Monday. These plenaries will cover the impact of climate change and environmental hazards on allergic disease, new insights on atopic dermatitis and the latest on the diagnosis and management of food allergy. For the Keynote Saturday at 3:30 pm, Peter Hotez, MD, PhD, DSc, an internationally-recognized physician- scientist in neglected tropical diseases and vaccine development, will lead a timely discussion on how we address both vaccine equity and a rising and aggressive antiscience empire. We are also excited to announce that on Monday after the Business Meeting, which is now from 8:15 to 9:15 am, and before the plenary session at 9:30 am, there will be a special virtual presentation from CDC Director Rochelle Walensky, MD, MPH. Download the Official Meeting App and Join the Social Media Conversation Visit the App Store or Play Store on your mobile device to download the official 2023 Annual Meeting app. Use it to organize your session schedule, access handouts and abstracts, respond to polls and ask questions in sessions, stay informed about program changes as they happen, and navigate the Henry B. González Convention Center with interactive maps and exhibitor information. Most importantly, the app offers the only way to complete faculty evaluations, and we need your feedback to make future programming improvements. If you post on social media during the meeting, use our #AAAAI23 hashtag so patients and other colleagues can follow what you are learning. Have Fun While Supporting A/I Research Fun and camaraderie with your fellow attendees await you at the AAAAI Foundation's events: Saturday's Benefit at the San Antonio Marriott Rivercenter and Sunday's 5k Run/Walk in Hemisfair Park. By registering and attending, you are helping fund A/I research that will improve the lives of your patients. We wish you a safe and fulfilling educational and networking experience as you reconnect with colleagues during your time in San Antonio. Sincerely, David A. Khan, MD FAAAAI Joshua A. Boyce, MD FAAAAI AAAAI President Chair, Annual Meeting Program Committee Welcome The AAAAI Registry Because Practice Matters! to the AAAAIQuality Clinical Data Registry: The AAAAI Registry hosts the only option for reporting specialty-developed Allergy/Immunology quality measures in the Merit-Based Incentive Payment System (MIPS) that reflect your practice: Asthma Control: Minimal Important Difference Improvement Appropriate Removal or Confirmation of Penicillin Allergy Assessment of Asthma Control Achievement of Projected Dose of Standardized Allergens in Patients on Immunotherapy for at least 1 Year Increase your CMS reimbursement Get ABAI Part IV MOC credits Complete Improvement Activity/Promoting Interoperability requirements The AAAAI Quality Clinical Data Registry is provided as a service to our members in conjunction with ArborMetrixwww.aaaai.org/registryMake 2023 the year YOU get connected.Adverse Events Reporting Module: The AAAAI Registry hosts a real-time immunotherapy safety reporting module. Protect inoffice compounding of allergen extracts by participating in allergen immunotherapy safety data collection.New! Admission to Sessions Admission to Annual Meeting educational sessions is reserved for meeting registrants and registered members of the press only. Guests and exhibitors will not be admitted to educational sessions. Ushers will monitor the name badges of all meeting attendees to control access to educational sessions. Some sessions require tickets for entry, which are indicated in this program with a ticket icon. Ticketed sessions have limited attendance and an additional fee. All educational sessions requiring such fees will be noted in the sessions by day schedule. Please visit the Registration Desk to register for ticketed sessions. In consideration of state fire codes and as a courtesy to others, those without tickets will not be allowed access into ticketed sessions. American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology Foundation (AAAAI Foundation) Convention Center, Lobby Level, Hall 1 Concourse Visit the AAAAI Foundation desk to learn more about our 2023 Lectureship Series, Faculty Development Awards and special events. Purchase and pick up your Annual Benefit tickets Register for and pick up your Run/Walk race packets Purchase Running with the President and New Allergist/ Immunologist Assembly Ribbons. You can make a donation to the AAAAI Foundation's GAIN Campaign at any time by pressing the DONATE icon on the Annual Meeting app or visiting our website aaaaifoundation.org/give Foundation Booth Hours: Thursday, February 23 12:00 to 7:00 pm Friday, February 24 7:30 am to 4:00 pm Saturday, February 25 7:30 am to 4:00 pm Sunday, February 26 7:30 am to 4:00 pm AAAAI Journals Convention Center, Lobby Level, Hall 1 Concourse Key representatives from The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology (JACI), the most-cited allergy/immunology journal, and sister journals The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology: In Practice (JACI: In Practice) and The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology: Global (JACI: Global) will be available to answer your questions regarding subscriptions and submissions. Annual Meeting Mobile App Sponsored by AstraZeneca The AAAAI has a mobile app dedicated to the 2023 Annual Meeting. This app features tools allowing you to search by speaker or session type, organize your schedule, evaluate speakers and sessions, claim credits, respond to polls and ask questions in sessions, stay current with changes as they occur during the meeting, and navigate the Convention Center with floor plans and exhibitor information. Download the 2023 Annual Meeting app from the App Store or Play Store on your mobile device. Associates to the AAAAI See Hospitality Suite. Charging lounge locations are as follows: Convention Center, Hall 2: Sponsored by GSK Convention Center, Lobby Level, Hall 2, 1100 Aisle Sponsored by Sanofi and Regeneron Convention Center, Lobby Level, Hall 2, 1900 Aisle Convention Center Concourses: Sponsored by Takeda Convention Center, Ballroom Level, Stars at Night Pre-Function Sponsored by Sanofi and Regeneron Convention Center, Ballroom Level, Hemisfair Pre-Function8 Meeting InformationChildren and Guests The AAAAI asks delegates to refrain from taking children, spouses or guests to any educational session offered at the 2023 Annual Meeting. Registered guests are welcome to relax in the Hospitality Suite or visit the Exhibit Hall; however, an adult must accompany children under the age of 18 at all times. Most San Antonio hotels can provide their guests with a list of independent babysitters and babysitting agencies frequently used by visitors. For more information, please contact the concierge at the appropriate hotel. Emergency In the event of an emergency, please use any telephone available (including courtesy phones located throughout the Convention Center) to call the In-House Security Division at (210) 207-7773. At the Marriott, dial 0 from any house phone. At the Hyatt, dial 55 from any house phone. Evaluations Delegates will be able to provide feedback on their experiences at the Annual Meeting in two ways: Participants will be asked to provide input on the educational program of the 2023 Annual Meeting through the online CME Claim System when claiming credit for participation. Delegates can provide feedback on Annual Meeting faculty members and the sessions they attend by using the mobile app. Exhibits Convention Center, Lobby Level, Hall 2 The exhibiting companies and organizations will provide you with the latest information on products and services available to physicians, researchers and allied health professionals in the field of allergy/ immunology. The directory on page 110 will provide you with the information you need to take full advantage of the opportunities offered by exhibitors. Please allow adequate time in your daily schedule to visit the exhibits. Take time to speak with representatives of companies that provide services or market products directly related to your professional interests. Handouts can be searched by session number, session title or a speaker's last name. These badges have a QR code on the back that is embedded with the attendee's name, mailing address, phone number and email address. Delegates may choose to allow their badges to be scanned in the Exhibit Hall and give their contact information to specific exhibitors. Please note: When you allow an exhibitor/sponsor to scan your badge, you are authorizing them to contact you and send you materials via postal mail, phone number and/or email. The AAAAI cannot be responsible for the use of your contact information once you have given it to an exhibitor/sponsor. Networking Lounge Relax between sessions and connect with colleagues. Hyatt: Sponsored by Sanofi and Regeneron Hyatt, Fourth Floor, Texas Pre-Function Nursing/Lactation Room Convention Center, Lobby Level, corridor between Halls 3 & 4 Convention Center, Meeting Room Level, adjacent to Room 215 The Convention Center offers two Nursing Mother's Rooms for nursing guests. Rooms are available during all event hours and are first-come, first-served. Photography Personal photography is allowed within the educational sessions and the Poster Hall, unless the speaker or poster presenter explicitly states otherwise. A camera icon with a black circle and slash on posters or slides indicates that picture taking is not allowed. Delegates are also welcome to take photographs at all other AAAAI functions and activities. Please be mindful to turn off your flash during a presentation. A professional photographer will be on site to document the Annual Meeting. By registering for and taking part in the Annual Meeting, your photo may be taken and used in future promotional materials. If you do not want your photo used, please inform the staff photographer at the time the photograph is taken. Poster Hall Convention Center, Lobby Level, Hall 2 The poster sessions, featuring presentations of abstracts in thematic groupings, are open Friday through Sunday. Authors will be present with their posters from 3:15 to 4:15 pm on Friday and 9:45 to 10:45 am on Saturday and Sunday. Visit the AAAAI Practice Management Hub for the latest information on compounding standards and get hands-on experience with the requirements. Practice management experts will be on hand daily to answer questions on topics like compounding, coding conundrums, penicillin allergy testing, negotiation strategies, and more. Come share with us your advocacy, practice management, and patient access priorities. Check signage for specific topics, hours and experts. Meet your colleagues here. Practice Management Hub Hours: Friday, February 24 12:00 to 4:00 pm Saturday, February 25 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Sunday, February 26 8:30 am to 4:00 pm Monday, February 27 9:00 am to 12:00 pm Press Room Convention Center, Meeting Room Level, Room 208 Members of the press representing print, broadcast and electronic consumer media, as well as healthcare trade media, are invited to attend the 2023 Annual Meeting if they have pre-registered at annualmeeting.aaaai.org. To claim a press pass on site, journalists must provide media identification or a business card issued by their news organization. Freelance writers must provide a letter of assignment on a news organization letterhead or bylined articles from a recognized news organization. Press passes will only be issued to journalists representing the editorial staff of print, broadcast or internet media. Journalists must display their press passes at all times while attending the meeting or covering meeting-sponsored events. The AAAAI does not issue press passes to: a publication's advertising, marketing, public relations or sales representatives; publishers, editors or reporters from manufacturers' in-house or promotional publications; public relations staff of exhibitors or educational institutions; writers creating analyses or reports sold as a commodity to customers; or other individuals who are not actually reporting on the meeting or on behalf of a specific media outlet. Exhibitors may not register as press. Journalists must also follow AAAAI Health and Safety Protocols including vaccination requirements. Quiet Reflection Room Convention Center, Meeting Room Level, Room 209 This room has been designated for prayer and meditation and is available for use at the Annual Meeting during the regular hours of operation. 10 Meeting InformationRecording of Sessions Individual recording of educational sessions is not permitted. Recordings of the Annual Meeting will be available online approximately two weeks after the conclusion of the live meeting. The recordings include presentation slides along with video and audio for the Plenary and Keynote sessions, and presentation slides synchronized with the audio recordings for selected courses, symposia, Interest Section Forums, workshops, pro/con debates and allied health sessions. Sessions included in the Virtual Annual Meeting are indicated with in this program. The 2023 stations will feature three options: Saturday, February 25, 12:00 to 2:00 pm 2401 Patch Testing: Basics and Beyond 2402 Current and Emerging Digital Technologies in Asthma Sunday, February 26, 12:00 to 2:00 pm 3401 Oral Food Challenges (OFCs) For complete details, please see the Online Program. This Interactive Showcase in severe asthma will keep attendees engaged as they progress through a series of educational modules, actively participating by web-based application via mobile device. During the first of three modules, attendees will proceed through an expert-guided poster tour briefly reviewing the underlying mechanisms of severe asthma. Following completion, attendees will attend a live expert roundtable session where faculty will discuss evolving management approaches, including the use of newer agents that target inflammatory mediators of disease. During the final module, attendees will participate in an interactive case study, applying information acquired to real-time management decisions. Rutland, MD Join our allergy and pulmonary experts from across different practice areas as they discuss the next frontier of severe asthma care and the endpoints that may define clinical remission. Optimizing Biologic Therapy in Children with Moderate-to-Severe Atopic Dermatitis Friday, February 24, 6:30 to 8:30 pm CST Registration and Reception | 6:30 to 7:00 pm CST Symposium and Panel Discussions | 7:00 to 8:30 pm CST Hyatt, Second Floor, Lone Star A This activity is supported by an educational grant from Sanofi and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals. Atopic dermatitis (AD) typically manifests in infancy and is often the first presenter in a series of type 2 inflammatory diseases commonly referred to as "the atopic march". While novel therapies have been recently made available for adults and teens, the treatment landscape for infants and children is finally catching up. In this multidisciplinary, interprofessional panel featuring allergists, dermatologists, physicians, a PA, eczema educator, and a parent/guardian of a child with AD, experts will discuss the pathophysiology of AD, new and emerging biologics for pediatric AD, and how to approach AD management with an effective team-based strategy. Attend in-person or via simulcast. Register for the event at www.RMEI.com/Atopic-Dermatitis-Feb-24 Advances in Managing Chronic Rhinosinusitis with Nasal Polyps: Practice-Changing Pearls for the Clinician Friday, February 24, 8:30 to 9:30 pm CST 8:15 to 8:30 pm CST Registration & Dinner 8:30 to 9:30 pm CST Symposium Hyatt, Fourth Floor, Texas Ballroom C This activity is provided by Med Learning Group. This activity is co- provided by AMEDCO. This activity is supported by an independent medical education grant from Regeneron Pharmaceuticals, Inc. and Sanofi. In this program we will aim to: (1) enhance clinicians' knowledge of the relationship between CRSwNP endotypes and pathophysiology, which can inform clinical decision-making; (2) improve familiarity with data from clinical trials assessing the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of available and emerging therapeutic options; and (3) discuss how to implement strategies to identify those who are appropriate candidates for biologic therapy. We will use a combination of didactic lecture, video animations, and patient cases to effectively teach clinicians who manage this condition. Faculty: Cecelia Damask, DO Stella E. It Takes a Village: Two Multidisciplinary Panel Discussion Programs Saturday, February 25, 6:00 to 8:00 am CST Hyatt, Fourth Floor, Texas D Sponsored by GSK Join experts for two interactive disease state programs. Program 1: Crafting a Multidisciplinary Approach to EGPA/HES: What are the Next Steps in Diagnosis? 6:00 to 6:45 am CST Speakers: Njira Lugogo, MD, Princess Ogbogu, MD, Philip Seo, MD Program 1 will focus on a case-based discussion of rare eosinophilic disorders, eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA) and hypereosinophilic syndrome (HES). These diseases may present similarly and are often a diagnostic challenge. Come together as a village, taking a multidisciplinary, collaborative approach to facilitating the diagnosis and management of these diseases. Program 2: The Expected and Unexpected Roles of Key Inflammatory Mediators in CRSwNP 7:00 to 7:45 am CST Speakers: Joshua Levy, MD, MPH, MSc along with Expert Allergist (TBD) Program 2 will focus on the expected and unexpected roles of key inflammatory mediators in chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis (CRSwNP), which are not fully understood. Join an allergy and ENT expert as they engage in an interactive discussion on the role of key inflammatory mediators in CRSwNP , including IgE, IL4, IL13, and IL5. Sunday, February 26, 6:30 to 8:30 pm CST Hyatt, Fourth Floor, Texas D Sponsored by CSL Behring Join Prof. Riedl, Prof. Maurer, and Dr. Busse in an exciting interactive symposium focusing on managing patients with hereditary angioedema (HAE) and sharing best practices. HAE is highly debilitating, and may significantly affect a person's quality of life and mental well-being. When left untreated, it is potentially life-threatening. Early intervention and optimized HAE management approaches are essential to prevent unfavorable outcomes and reduce HAE's negative impact on patients' lives. This symposium will explore the overall burden of HAE and provide guidance on identifying opportunities to improve patient treatment outcomes and experience. Reframing Rescue Therapy to Help Prevent Asthma Exacerbations Sunday, February 26, 8:30 to 10:30 pm Hyatt, Second Floor, Lone Star A Sponsored by AstraZeneca Please join us as we discuss asthma burden in the United States. Data on a new rescue therapy treatment option will be reviewed. AAAAI-1122-19135 35 Continuing Education & AccreditationContinuing Education and Accreditation Two types of continuing education credit will be available for participants in the 2023 AAAAI Annual Meeting: AMA PRA Category 1 CME Credits for physicians and Continuing Education (CE) contact hours for nurses. Not all Annual Meeting sessions may offer credit, and of those that do, not all may offer both CME and CE. Credit Claiming: Continuing education credits and attendance certificates can be claimed online beginning Thursday, February 23, 2023 using the link provided on the Annual Meeting website and in the mobile app. Credit claiming will be available through December 31, 2023. Physicians - Continuing Medical Education (CME) Credits Accreditation Statement The American Academy of Allergy, Asthma and Immunology (AAAAI) is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education to provide continuing medical education for physicians. Credit Designation The AAAAI designates this Other activity (combination of live activity and recorded online content) for a maximum of 251.00 AMA PRA Category 1 Credits. Physicians should claim only the credit commensurate with the extent of their participation in the activity. The American Medical Association has determined that physicians not licensed in the U.S. who participate in this CME activity are eligible for AMA PRA Category 1 Credits. Target Audience The AAAAI Annual Meeting is designed for clinicians, researchers, trainees/students and allied health professionals involved and/or interested in the study of allergy, asthma and immunology. Program Objective Upon completion of the AAAAI Annual Meeting, participants should be able to discuss the latest advances in the research, diagnosis and treatment of allergic and immunologic disease. Please refer to the individual session descriptions in this program for session-specific learning objectives. ABAI - Continuing Medical Education (CME) Credits The American Board of Allergy and Immunology (ABAI) requires diplomates to attest to obtaining 25 AMA PRA Category 1 CME Credits in allergy/immunology each year. AAAAI reports all CME credits it issues to physician learners to the ABAI on a quarterly basis, to be posted in learners' diplomate portals. For more information about credit requirements for ABAI Maintenance of Certification, visit the ABAI website at https://abai.org/cme.asp. Allied Health - Continuing Education (CE) Credits Nurses - Continuing Education (CE) Contact Hours The American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (AAAAI) is a Provider, approved by the California Board of Registered Nursing, Provider #10704, for up to 251.00 Contact Hours.Advanced Practitioners The AAPA, ANCC and AANP accept reports from advanced practitioners of their participation in activities offering AMA PRA Category 1 Credits for continuing education and credentialing purposes. For more information, please contact the appropriate organization. Pharmacists Accreditation Statement In support of improving patient care, this activity has been planned and implemented by Amedco LLC and American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology. Amedco LLC is jointly accredited by the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education (ACCME), the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), and the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), to provide continuing education for the healthcare team. Pharmacists and Pharmacy Technicians (ACPE) Credit Designation This activity has been approved for knowledge-based CPE contact hours. NOTE to Pharmacists: The only official Statement of Credit is the one you pull from CPE Monitor. You must request your certificate within 30 days of your participation in the activity to meet the deadline for submission to CPE Monitor. Registered Dietitians The Commission on Dietetic Registration accepts reports from registered dietitians of their participation in activities offering AMA PRA Category 1 Credits for continuing education and credentialing purposes. Contact the CDR for details on how to report completion of these activities. Medical Administrators Practice administrators who attend the 2023 AAAAI Annual Meeting may apply for credit through the American College of Medical Practice Executives (ACMPE). For additional information, please contact the Medical Group Management Association at www.mgma.com. Target Audience Health care professionals who assist with and provide care to persons with asthma, allergic and immunologic diseases, specifically: RNs, LPNs, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, respiratory therapists, medical technologists, medical assistants, clinical research coordinators, and practice managers/administrators. Learning Objectives Upon completion of the AAAAI Annual Meeting, participants should be able to discuss and expand upon the latest advances in medications, equipment and procedures necessary to promote health for their patients; describe and discuss new therapies, information, patient care and education in the field of allergy, asthma and immunology; identify new approaches to clinical research which will improve efficiency and effectiveness; and discuss coding and other administrative aspects of a medical practice. Please refer to the individual session descriptions in this program for session-specific learning objectives. The AAAAI Family of Journals Leading the Way in Allergy / Immunology Research Since 1929 The American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (AAAAI) is the leader in allergy/ immunology research and is proud to publish three official journals featuring the latest scientific breakthroughs, allowing us to provide optimal care to our patients. Visit the Journals booth near the Member Resource Center in San Antonio to learn more about the AAAAI family of journals and pick up your complimentary copies. Celebrating 10 Years! The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology: In Practice The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology: Global Official JOurnal Of The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology: JACI An Official Journal of the Covering the spectrum of diseases in allergy/ immunology, The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology: In Practice has been providing practical clinical research and the latest recommendations for diagnosis and treatment for a decade. Respected worldwide, The Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology is the most cited journal in the field of allergy and clinical immunology, focusing on clinical medicine and basic science. Covering original research in allergy and immunology, basic science, Phase I/II clinical trials, population studies, and more from around the world, JACI: Global is the AAAAI's Gold Open Access Journal. AAAAIF-0822-1682024 AWARD TIMELINE Letter of Intent Opens: July 2023 Letter of Intent Due: September 2023 Top Finalists Notified: September 2023 Complete Applications Due: November 2023 Review Results Announced: December 2023 This mentored award provides up to $240,000 in funding over a three-year period and is intended to support the development of careers in Allergy and Immunology. Multiple awards will be made to further the development of junior faculty into independent investigators by funding excellent research that leads to the prevention and cure of asthma and allergic and immunologic diseases. The AAAAI Foundation is especially interested in funding health equity research as it applies to allergy and immunology, as well as research that promotes awareness of diversity and inclusivity within the field of allergy and immunology. The AAAAI Foundation is committed to increasing ethnic and racial diversity in the A/I field, and strongly encourages minority applicants to apply. Further, the AAAAI Foundation is committed to geographic diversity in the A/I field, and strongly encourages applications from diverse geographic areas. To learn more please visit aaaai.org/About/AAAAI-Diversity-Equity-and-Inclusion- Statement Eligibility: Must be board certified in A/I by the American Board of Allergy and Immunology (ABAI) or hold the equivalent certification from the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada (RCPSC). At the time of Letter of Intent, applicant must be no more than 5 years post the ACGME mandated training program requirement of 2 years in A/I. Primary faculty appointment must be in the discipline of A/I and the applicant needs to have a current mentor. One of the following degrees: MD, MD/PhD, DO, DO/PhD. Applicants must be citizens or permanent residents of the United States or Canada. Applicants must be AAAAI members or submit a membership application prior to submitting a Letter of Intent. No program can have more than 2 active Foundation Faculty Development Awards. A sponsoring university or institution that has multiple A/I training programs cannot have more than three active awards. Award term is July 1, 2024 to June 30, 2027. AAAAI-1122-180Workshops (continued)Asthma is one of the most common medical problems seen by allergy/immunology clinicians, affecting more than an estimated 339 million people worldwide. Improve asthma management for patients via our new online course series: The NHLBI 2020 Focused Updates to the Asthma Management Guidelines An Overview NAEPP has issued guidelines since 1991. In 2020, the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) released Focused Updates to the Asthma Management Guidelines. Gain insight into the meaning and practical application of the guidelines.An Adult Virtual Patient Activity Through visits with an adult patient, you will make decisions about the diagnosis and management based on the updated guidelines relating to asthma medications (including ICS, LABA, and LAMA), allergen mitigation, immunotherapy, and FeNO.A Pediatric Virtual Patient Activity Through visits with a pediatric pa - tient and their family, you will make decisions about the diagnosis and management based on the updated guidelines relating to FeNO, allergen mitigation, ICS, intervention, and immunotherapy. Barber, NP CPNPLeadership Institute Course alumni are eligible to apply for the Leadership Institute Mentorship Program, which pairs mentees with an AAAAI faculty mentor to develop and complete a project within their area of interest that aligns with the goals of an existing AAAAI committee or taskforce. Applications for the 2024 Leadership Institute Mentorship Program will open in the Fall of 2023. Eligible alumni will receive an email invite to apply.LEADERSHIP INSTITUTE MENTORSHIP PROGRAMThe Leadership Institute Course is a half-day program held during the AAAAI Annual Meeting and incorporates instruction in key leadership skills such as negotiation, conflict resolution, and goal setting. Optional asynchronous learning and networking opportunities for Course alumni also occur throughout the year. Applications for the 2024 Leadership Institute Course will open in the Fall of 2023.
